abstract: The Swiss central bank’s failure to fight its appreciating currency will have no immediate consequences for the wider economy, which is expected to grow 2.5 percent in 2010.
snippet: The Swiss central bank’s failure to fight its appreciating currency will have no immediate consequences for the wider economy, which is expected to grow 2.5 percent in 2010.
lead_paragraph: While the rest of Europe struggles to rein in government debt, there is no talk of forced austerity in prudent Switzerland. Instead, the country is looking forward to growth of at least 2.5 percent this year, thanks to booming exports, Jack Ewing writes in The New York Times.

headline.main: Switzerland Tries to Check Franc and Aid Exports
